intro: Dimerocostus strobilaceus subsp. gutierrezii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its leaves are often arranged in a rosette pattern. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
